pullRequest.body:
This file defines finite places of a number field `K` as absolute values coming from an embedding
into a completion of `K` associated to a non-zero prime ideal of `ùìû K` with some basic APIs.

This is part of a project which aims to define heights. The next step is the product formula.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [d549a0d93e](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19667/commits/d549a0d93e39b090a1bff246a32749af185a0897)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.NumberTheory.NumberField.FinitePlaces` (new file)|2399|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ FinitePlace`
`+ FinitePlace.mk`
`+ FinitePlace.norm_def`
`+ apply`
`+ embedding`
`+ eq_iff_eq`
`+ instNormedFieldValuedAdicCompletion`
`+ instRankOneValuedAdicCompletion`
`+ instance : FunLike (FinitePlace K) K ‚Ñù`
`+ instance : MonoidWithZeroHomClass (FinitePlace K) K ‚Ñù`
`+ instance : NonnegHomClass (FinitePlace K) K ‚Ñù`
`+ le_iff_le`
`+ max_ideal_mk`
`+ maximal_ideal`
`+ mk_eq_iff`
`+ mk_max_ideal`
`+ mulSupport_Finite`
`+ mulSupport_Finite_int`
`+ norm_embedding_eq`
`+ norm_eq_one_iff_not_mem`
`+ norm_le_one`
`+ norm_lt_one_iff_mem`
`+ one_lt_norm`
`+ pos_iff`
`+ vadic_abv`
`+ vadic_abv_def`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

```suggestion
    exact (v.asIdeal.fintypeQuotientOfFreeOfNeBot v.ne_bot).finite
```
Dot notation allows to write this more compactly.

```suggestion
  toFun x := toNNReal (norm_ne_zero v) (v.valuation x)
  map_mul' _ _ := by simp only [_root_.map_mul, NNReal.coe_mul]
  nonneg' _ := NNReal.zero_le_coe
  eq_zero' _ := by simp only [NNReal.coe_eq_zero, map_eq_zero]
  add_le' x y := by
```
This is notation that tends to be more readable.

```suggestion
    -- the triangle inequality is implied by the ultrametric one
```

```suggestion
    have h_mono := (toNNReal_strictMono (one_lt_norm v)).monotone
    rw [‚Üê h_mono.map_max] --max goes inside withZeroMultIntToNNReal
    exact h_mono (v.valuation.map_add x y)
```
if you want to use dot notation. (It is a matter of taste and takes some getting used to.)

```suggestion
noncomputable def vadicAbv : AbsoluteValue K ‚Ñù where
```
This is a term of a non-Prop type, so should be in lower camel case as per the [naming convention](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/naming.html) (point 4).

```suggestion
/-- The embedding of a `NumberField` inside its completion with respect to `v`. -/
```
if you want to use the lean name, or
```suggestion
/-- The embedding of a number field inside its completion with respect to `v`. -/
```

```suggestion
  @UniformSpace.Completion.coeRingHom K _ v.adicValued.toUniformSpace _ _
```
what comes after the `:=` is indented two spaces.

```suggestion
def FinitePlace (K : Type*) [Field K] [NumberField K] :=
  {w : AbsoluteValue K ‚Ñù //
```
If the definition doesn't fit on the remainder of the line, it should start in the following line (with 2 spaces indentation).

The `rfl` here points to a missing API lemma (note that `NNReal.coe_inj` above is not actually used by `simp`) of the form `(WithZeroMulInt.toNNReal _ (Valued.v x) : ‚Ñù) = (vadic_abv v) x` or similar (whose proof will be `rfl`).

pullRequest.title: feat(NumberTheory/NumberField/FinitePlaces): the finite places of a number field
